Definition: from {{h7235}}; a multitude; also offspring; specifically interest (on capital); greatest part, greatness, increase, multitude.
from {{h7257}}; a reclining place, i.e. fold (for flocks); couching place, place to lie down.
apparently feminine passive causative participle of {{h7200}}; something conspicuous, i.e. the craw of a bird (from its prominence); crop.
denominative from {{h7218}}; properly, headship, i.e. (plural for collective) dominion; principality.
or מַרֵשָׁה; formed like {{h4761}}; summit; Mareshah, the name of two Israelites and of a place in Palestine; Mareshah.
formed like {{h4761}}; properly, a headpiece, i.e. (plural for adverbial) at (or as) the head-rest (or pillow); bolster, head, pillow. Compare {{h4772}}.
from {{h7231}}; increase; Merab, a daughter of Saul; Merab.
from {{h7234}}; a coverlet; covering of tapestry.
from {{h7235}}; properly, increasing; as noun, greatness, or (adverbially) greatly; great, increase.
from {{h7235}}; abundance, i.e. a great quantity; much.
from the same as {{h5348}} in the denominative sense of herding (compare {{h5349}}); fold; Makkedah, a place in Palestine; Makkedah.
from {{h5344}}; properly, a perforator, i.e. a hammer (as piercing); also (intransitively) a perforation, i.e. a quarry; hammer, hole.
from {{h6884}}; a crucible; fining pot.
dual of {{h4693}}; Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt; Egypt, Egyptians, Mizraim.
from {{h5344}}; properly, a perforatrix, i.e. a hammer (as piercing); hammer.
from {{h4743}}; properly, a melting, i.e. putridity; rottenness, stink.
a primitive root; to suck; milk.
from {{h6845}}; a secret (place or thing, perhaps, treasure); hidden thing.
from {{h4714}}; a Mitsrite, or inhabitant of Mitsrajim; Egyptian, of Egypt.
from {{h6869}}; something tight, i.e. (figuratively) trouble; distress, pain, strait.
from {{h4838}}; properly, rubbed; but used abstractly, a rubbing (with perfumery); purification.
or מְרֻצָה; feminine of {{h4793}}; a race (the act), whether the manner or the progress; course, running. Compare {{h4835}}.
from an unused root meaning to scream; a cry, i.e. (of job), a revel; banquet.
plural of {{h4751}} feminine; bitter springs; Maroth, a place in Palestine; Maroth.

from {{h7311}}; altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft); (far) above, dignity, haughty, height, (most, on) high (one, place), loftily, upward.
from {{h4799}}; bruised, i.e. emasculated; broken.
from {{h7323}}; a run (the trial of speed); race.
formed like {{h4791}}; height; Merom, a lake in Palestine; Merom.
a primitive root; properly, to soften by rubbing or pressure; hence (medicinally) to apply as an emollient; lay for a plaister.
formed like {{h4797}}; a cry, i.e. (of grief) a lamentation; mourning.
the same as {{h4707}}; Mitspeh, the name of five places in Palestine; Mizpeh, watch tower. Compare {{h4709}}.
feminine of {{h4708}}; Mitspah, the name of two places in Palestine; Mitspah. (This seems rather to be only an orthographic variation of {{h4708}} when 'in pause'.)
the same as {{h4705}}; Mitsar, a peak of Lebanon; Mizar.
from {{h6822}}; an observatory, especially for military purposes; watch tower.
feminine of {{h4705}}; properly, littleness; concretely, diminutive; little.
from {{h6819}}; petty (in size or number); adverbially, a short (time); little one (while), small.
from {{h3331}}; a couch; bed.
from {{h6805}}; a step; figuratively, companionship; going, step.
from {{h6801}}; a tiara, i.e. official turban (of a king or high priest); diadem, mitre.
from {{h4843}}; bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) trouble; grief.
a form of {{h4786}}; trouble; bitterness.

a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke); bitter, change, be disobedient, disobey, grievously, provocation, provoke(-ing), (be) rebel (against, -lious).
the same as {{h4751}} feminine; bitter; Marah, a place in the Desert; Marah.
of foreign derivation; Mordecai, an Israelite; Mordecai.
from {{h7291}}; persecuted; persecuted.
from {{h4775}}; rebelliousness; × rebellious.
of foreign derivation; Merodak, a Babylonian idol; Merodach. Compare {{h4757}}.
from {{h7300}} in the sense of maltreatment; an outcast; (abstractly) destitution; cast out, misery.
of uncertain derivation; Meroz, a place in Palestine; Meroz.
from {{h7112}}; end; Makats, a place in Palestine; Makaz.
from {{h7080}}; an augury; divination.
from {{h7038}} in the sense of taking in; an asylum (as a receptacle); refuge.
(or perhaps mik-kel-ohth') plural of (feminine) {{h4731}}; rods; Mikloth, a place in the Desert; Mikloth.
or (feminine) מַקְּלָה; from an unused root meaning apparently to germinate; a shoot, i.e. stick (with leaves on, or for walking, striking, guiding, divining); rod, (hand-)staff.
feminine of {{h4729}}; something to fume (incense) in, i.e. a coal-pan; censer.
from {{h4735}} and {{h3050}}; possession of Jah; Miknejah, an Israelite; Mikneiah.
feminine of {{h4735}}; properly, a buying, i.e. acquisition; concretely, a piece of property (land or living); also the sum paid; (he that is) bought, possession, piece, purchase.
from {{h7069}}; something bought, i.e. property, but only live stock; abstractly, acquisition; cattle, flock, herd, possession, purchase, substance.
from {{h7049}}; a sculpture (probably in bas-relief); carved (figure), carving, graving.
feminine of {{h4723}}; a collection, i.e. (of water) a reservoir; ditch.

or מָקֹם; also (feminine) מְקוֹמָה; or מְקֹמָה; from {{h6965}}; properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind); country, × home, × open, place, room, space, × whither(-soever).

or מָקֹר; from {{h6979}}; properly, something dug, i.e. a (general) source (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female pudenda); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny); fountain, issue, spring, well(-spring).
from {{h3947}}; reception; taking.
or מִקְּדָשׁ; (Exodus 15:17), from {{h6942}}; a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum; chapel, hallowed part, holy place, sanctuary.
or (feminine) מַקְהֵלָה; from {{h6950}}; an assembly; congregation.
plural of {{h4721}} (feminine); assemblies; Makheloth, a place in the Desert; Makheloth.

or מִקְוֵה; (1 Kings 10:28), or מִקְוֵאlemma מִּקְוֵא extra dagesh, corrected to מִקְוֵא; (2 Chronicles 1:16), from {{h6960}}; something waited for, i.e. confidence (objective or subjective); also a collection, i.e. (of water) a pond, or (of men and horses) a caravan or drove; abiding, gathering together, hope, linen yarn, plenty (of water), pool.
from {{h7337}}; enlargement, either literally (an open space, usually in a good sense), or figuratively (liberty); breadth, large place (room).
from {{h3947}}; something received, i.e. merchandise (purchased); ware.
from {{h6999}}; something to fume (incense) on i.e. a hearth place; to burn...upon.
or (feminine) מָרָה; from {{h4843}}; bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly; angry, bitter(-ly, -ness), chafed, discontented, × great, heavy.
denominative from {{h7180}}; literally a cucumbered field, i.e. a cucumber patch; garden of cucumbers.
or מוֹר; from {{h4843}}; myrrh (as distilling in drops, and also as bitter); myrrh.
from {{h4843}} in its original sense of distillation; a drop; drop.
for {{h4751}} feminine; bitter; Mara, a symbolic name of Naomi; Mara.
a primitive root; to rebel; hence (through the idea of maltreating) to whip, i.e. lash (self with wings, as the ostrich in running); be filthy, lift up self.
of foreign derivation; Merodak-Baladan, a Babylonian king; Merodach-baladan. Compare {{h4781}}.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h4754}} in the sense of domineering; a master; lord, Lord.
feminine of {{h4758}}; a vision; also (causatively) a mirror; looking glass, vision.

from {{h7200}}; a view (the act of seeing); also an appearance (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision; × apparently, appearance(-reth), × as soon as beautiful(-ly), countenance, fair, favoured, form, goodly, to look (up) on (to), look(-eth), pattern, to see, seem, sight, visage, vision.
from {{h7106}} in the denominative sense of bending; an angle; corner.
' a primitive root; to melt; figuratively, to flow, dwindle, vanish; consume away, be corrupt, dissolve, pine away.
or מַקְצֹעַ; or (feminine) מַקְצֹעָה; from {{h7106}} in the denominative sense of bending; an angle or recess; corner, turning.
from {{h7106}}; a scraper, i.e. a carving chisel; plane.
from {{h7136}}; properly, something meeting, i.e. a frame (of timbers); building.
from the same as {{h7119}}; a cooling off; × summer.
from {{h7121}}; something called out, i.e. a public meeting (the act, the persons, or the place); also a rehearsal; assembly, calling, convocation, reading.
from {{h7136}}; something met with, i.e. an accident or fortune; something befallen, befalleth, chance, event, hap(-peneth).
from {{h7185}} in the sense of knotting up round and hard; something turned (rounded), i.e. a curl (of tresses); × well (set) hair.
feminine of {{h4748}}; rounded work, i.e. moulded by hammering (repoussé); beaten (out of one piece, work), upright, whole piece.
(Aramaic) from the same as {{h4776}}; rebellious; rebellious.
the same as {{h4777}}; Mered, an Israelite; Mered.
from {{h4775}}; rebellion; rebellion.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h4775}}; rebellion; rebellion.
a primitive root; to rebel; rebel(-lious).
from {{h7280}}; rest; refreshing.
from {{h7275}}; a stone-heap; sling.
denominative from {{h7272}}; (plural for collective) a footpiece, i.e. (adverbially) at the foot, or (direct.) the foot itself; feet. Compare {{h4763}}.
from {{h7280}}; a resting place; rest.
from an unused root meaning to tie up; a stall (for cattle); × fat(-ted), stall.
